intro: Borreria elaiosulcata, commonly known as the narrow-ribbed borreria, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves with a narrow, ribbed appearance. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in dense inflorescences. Borreria elaiosulcata is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
